title: Marketplace necessities terminology, delivery status section, testimonials, seller ratings, donation budget UI, and checkout donate/anonymity flow + NGO 404 fixes

requirements.text: Rename/retitle marketplace language across the UI from generic 'Products' to 'Necessity Items' (including headings, buttons, empty states, and navigation labels) while keeping existing routes intact.
acceptanceCriteria: User-facing text in marketplace/browse/product-related pages uses 'Necessity Items' instead of 'Products' (where semantically applicable).
No routes break; existing navigation continues to work.

requirements.text: Fix NGO section navigation so clicking 'Post Requirements' and 'Delivery Tracking' does not show 'Not Found' by updating NGO navbar links to match existing routes in the router.

quotes: in ngo section post requirements and delivers whenc clicked not found is coming correct that too

acceptanceCriteria: NGO navbar 'Post Requirements' links to /ngo/requirements/post (not /ngo/requirements).
NGO navbar 'Delivery Tracking' links to /ngo/deliveries (not /ngo/tracking).
Navigating via NGO navbar no longer results in a Not Found state for these destinations.

requirements.text: Add a 'Delivery' section for end users that shows delivery status and allows navigating to a detailed tracking view using an existing trackingId-based route.

quotes: 2 delivery section which shows delivery status

acceptanceCriteria: A user-accessible page/section lists the userâ€™s deliveries with clear statuses (e.g., scheduled, picked-up, in-transit, delivered) using seeded/dummy data.
Each listed delivery provides a working link/button to open the existing tracking details route (/tracking/$trackingId).

requirements.text: Add a testimonials section to the public website with multiple dummy testimonials (name, role/type, short quote, and a rating) and render it in a prominent public location (e.g., Landing page).
acceptanceCriteria: A testimonials UI section is visible on the public site and contains at least 4 dummy testimonials.
Each testimonial shows a name and a short quote; ratings are visually represented (e.g., stars).

requirements.text: Add seller authenticity star ratings and review summaries to marketplace listings and product detail views using dummy data, and ensure the ratings are consistently displayed wherever seller info is shown.
acceptanceCriteria: Marketplace list cards show a seller rating (stars) and a review count (dummy values).
Product detail page shows seller rating (stars) and a short review summary/list (dummy values).
Ratings display is consistent across marketplace and product detail.

requirements.text: Ensure that opening a marketplace item shows a clear, readable description section on the product detail page (and handle missing descriptions gracefully with a sensible dummy fallback).
acceptanceCriteria: Product detail page includes a labeled description area that renders non-empty text for all seeded items (use fallback text if needed).
No product detail page appears without a description block.

requirements.text: Add a donation budgeting UI for donors: allow the donor to set a budget, and based on that budget show recommended donation necessity items (UI only; no backend logic required).

quotes: 6 Donator set a budge and based on that it shows recommended donation products just ui

acceptanceCriteria: There is an input/control for budget amount (currency consistent with the app) in an appropriate donation flow page.
Recommended items list updates client-side based on the entered budget (e.g., filters/sorts dummy recommended items that fit within budget).
No backend calls are required for generating recommendations.

requirements.text: Update the marketplace item checkout flow so that when a user initiates purchase from a product detail page, the UI offers: (1) Buy for yourself, or (2) Donate; if Donate is selected, prompt for 'Donate anonymously' vs 'Show my name'.

quotes: 7 when user buys product listed from items in marketplace give option buying for yourself or donating and when clicked on donating ask either anonymously or show your name.

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking 'Buy Now' (or equivalent) opens a choice between 'Buy for yourself' and 'Donate'.
If 'Donate' is chosen, the UI requires selecting either anonymous donation or showing donor name before continuing.
The selection is reflected in the UI summary/confirmation step (e.g., 'Donor: Anonymous' vs 'Donor: <Name>').

requirements.text: Show payment details during both buying and donating flows, including a clear cost breakdown (item price/donation amount, fees if any as dummy values, total), and payer/donor details (including anonymity selection when applicable).

quotes: also when buying or donating show payemnt details etc too

acceptanceCriteria: Donation flow shows a payment details panel/section before confirming submission (amount breakdown + donor info).
Marketplace purchase/donate flow shows a payment details panel/section before confirming (cost breakdown + recipient/delivery notes as dummy text if needed).
All values can be dummy but must be coherent and non-empty.

requirements.text: Populate all relevant pages/sections with realistic dummy data (maps, charts, analytics, tables, and lists) so that dashboards and analytics views do not appear empty or placeholder-only.

quotes: 8 pls fill every section with dummy data maps etc charts for analytics pls

acceptanceCriteria: Dashboards/analytics pages across roles (User/NGO/Delivery/Admin) render non-empty dummy datasets (lists and chart values).
Any map UI shown in delivery-related pages uses dummy route/markers and accompanying details (no external map integration required).
No primary page presents an empty state unless it is explicitly a 'no data' scenario with explanatory copy.

requirements.text: Apply a cohesive visual theme refresh across newly added/modified sections (testimonials, ratings, delivery status, checkout/payment panels, donation budget UI) with consistent typography, spacing, and a warm, trustworthy palette (avoid blue/purple).
acceptanceCriteria: New/updated UI sections share consistent component styling (cards, badges, headings, spacing).
Theme uses a warm/neutral palette (e.g., earth tones) and does not default to a blue/purple-centric look.
All user-facing text is in English.

constraints: Frontend files in immutablePaths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui (compose only).
Keep backend as a single Motoko actor; only introduce a migration file if persistent state schema changes are required.
No third-party auth providers; Internet Identity only (already in project).
No external databases or real payment integrations; payment details are UI/dummy data only.
nonGoals: Implement real payment processing or payment gateway integration.
Implement real seller verification or authenticity checks; ratings/reviews are dummy/UI-only unless existing local state already supports more.
Add real-time delivery updates via websockets/push notifications.
Replace TanStack Router with a different routing solution.
